document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic study of the genus Nosphistica Meyrick, 1911 (Lepidoptera Lecithoceridae) from China, with descriptions of seven new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic study of the genus Nosphistica Meyrick, 1911 (Lepidoptera Lecithoceridae) from China, with descriptions of seven new species

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Philoptila fenestrata
Gozmány, 1978: 189
. TL: China ( Fujian Province ). TD: ZMHB.

Diagnosis. Adult ( Fig. 12 ) wingspan 14.5–18.0 mm. This species is superficially similar to
N. erratica Meyrick, 1911
and
N. furmata
Oku et Sakamaki, 2018
. It differs from
N. erratica
in the male genitalia by the ventral margin of the valva convex medially ( Fig. 25 ), whereas the ventral margin of the valva is smooth in
N. erratica
( Clarke 1965: 186 , Pl. 93, Fig. 1 ). It can be distinguished from
N. furmata
by the dark brown discocellular stigma on the forewing, whereas it is white in
N. furmata
(
Oku et al. 2018: 108
, Figs. 3 , 4 ).
Distribution. China ( Fujian , Guangdong , Guangxi , Henan , Hubei , Shaanxi , Shanxi , Sichuan , Taiwan , Tianjin , Yunnan , Zhejiang ).
Variation. In some individuals, a tubular structure extends from the anterior margin of the ostium bursae into the ductus bursae in the female genitalia ( Fig. 33a ).
